change.title: Forestry Licence to Cut Regulation

change.changenote: Part 1, title enacted by BC Reg 157/2012, effective June 25, 2012.
Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 133/2011, effective July 21, 2011.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of section 47.6 (2) (d) of the Forest Act, the regional manager or district manager may enter into a forestry licence to cut under which harvesting is restricted to Crown timber that

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the opinion of the regional manager or district manager, is in danger, as a result of an insect infestation, fire, disease or windthrow, of being significantly reduced in value, lost or destroyed, or
must be harvested for insect management purposes.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a forestry licence to cut is entered into under subsection (1), it may, in the discretion of the regional manager or district manager, include Crown timber that

paragraph.paragraphtext: is interspersed with timber described in that subsection, or
must be harvested to provide access to timber described in that subsection.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (4), the total volume of Crown timber that may be specified in a forestry licence to cut entered into under this section must not exceed 2 000 m3.

The regional manager or district manager may enter into a forestry licence to cut for a volume exceeding 2 000 m3, but not exceeding 5 000 m3, if the forestry licence to cut is entered into as the result of a competitive process.

change.changenote: Section 4 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 133/2011, effective July 21, 2011.
